intro: Cracca lathyroides, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodland and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cracca lathyroides is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
